text: Darren Michael JesseeBMI Repertoire. Retrieved February 10, 2013 is an American drummer, songwriter and singer best known as a member of the alternative rock trio Ben Folds Five. Jessee has also worked as an instrumentalist for Sharon Van Etten and Hiss Golden Messenger and released four albums as singer and songwriter for indie band Hotel Lights. His first solo album, The Jane, Room 217, was released on August 24th, 2018 https://www.allmusic.com/album/the-jane-room-217-mw0003193499, to near- universal acclaim from critics. http://survivingthegoldenage.com/darren- jessee-the-jane-room-217/ Jessee formed indie band Hotel Lights in 2004 after many years writing songs, playing drums, and touring in the trio. Ben Folds, on an iTunes Originals compilation, credited the Jessee-penned chorus for "Brick" as the missing element to a song that he had tried to compose for a long time. Darren can also be heard drumming on the song "Strangest Thing" from The War on Drugs' 2017 album A Deeper Understanding, Hiss Golden Messenger's Hallelujah Anyhow (2017), and Josh Rouse's album Under Cold Blue Stars, released in 2002. ==Discography== Darren Jessee *The Jane, Room 217 (2018) *Remover (2020) Ben Folds Five *Ben Folds Five (1995) *Whatever and Ever Amen (1997) *Naked Baby Photos (1998) *The Unauthorized Biography of Reinhold Messner (1999) *The Sound of the Life of the Mind (2012) Hotel Lights *Hotel Lights (2006) *Firecracker People (2008) * Girl Graffiti (2011) * Get Your Hand in My Hand (2016) ==Songwriter== Hotel Lights is the project name for songwriter Darren Jessee. Notable Jessee songwriting contributions for Ben Folds Five include: *"Magic" (Jessee) – The Unauthorized Biography of Reinhold Messner *"Sky High" (Jessee) – The Sound of the Life of the Mind *"Brick" (Folds / Jessee) – Whatever and Ever Amen *"Song for the Dumped" (Folds / Jessee) – Whatever and Ever Amen *"Kate" (Folds / Jessee /Anna Goodman) – Whatever and Ever Amen *"Amelia Bright" (Jessee) – unreleased track performed live by the band 1999–2000; later featured on the Hotel Lights album Firecracker People.
